revised_title: Walter Heinrich Heither: A Life in Theoretical Physics and Science Philosophy
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Walter Heinrich Heither, a prominent theoretical physicist who made significant contributions to the fields of quantum mechanics, radiation theory, and mesons. Heither's work in the early days of quantum chemistry, along with his later studies on the relationship between man, science, and religion, are highlighted. His life and career, from his early education to his time in various universities, are also discussed.
